name: Black Walnut Inn

reviews.text: We stayed here two nights to attend a squash tournament at Amherst College. The rooms are very spacious with sitting areas and the rooms are decorated beautifully. The breakfast was delicious. Marie's homemade baked goods were outstanding. Marie and Dan were very friendly and the hard work and the care they put into refurbishing this historic home is clearly evident. We recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Awesome bed and breakfast

reviews.text: The room was charming and spotless, the breakfasts were filled with homemade items (including bacon produced down the road) and the location was right on the #31 bus to UMASS and Amherst College. We would love to stay here again!
reviews.title: Amazing Breakfasts!

reviews.text: The home made breakfast was amazing, Penny made the most delicious blueberry Muffins. The room was out of this world. All of the staff was very welcoming and friendly. Can't wait to return and bring my family!
reviews.title: Just Wonderful!!!!!

reviews.text: Absolutely love it! Best B&B ever.
reviews.title: Black Walnut Inn in Amherst, MA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Warm and friendly, the Black Walnut Inn is an excellent B&B in Amherst, Mass near the UMass campus and local sites of interest. Marie, the owner, was a lovely hostess and great breakfast chef. Loved the freshly made muffins and bread at breakfast each morning! Our room was large with a full bath and half bath. The gas stove kept us toasty warm and provided some nice ambiance. Give the Black Walnut Inn a try if you are in the Amherst area. You will enjoy your stay!
reviews.title: Lovely B&B but choose room carefully

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely rooms, fabulous breakfast, and great company at the community breakfast table -- this bed and breakfast style inn is an absolute delight! We've stayed there many times and always look forward to going back!
reviews.title: What a Treat!

reviews.text: We cannot say enough great things about Marie and the Black Walnut Inn!
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Blizzard of 2013 left us without power and literally snowed in so that we had to change our reservation to (tentatively) the next night. Marie was so cool about it and told us not to worry. We did go the next day and that first shower was heaven and washed all the chill right out of me!
reviews.title: Perfect. New England charming.

reviews.text: We stayed in the Carhart Room which was historic, spotless and so lovely. We were in Amherst to visit our daughter and to sit on the comfy couch in front of the gas "wood" stove after the stress of weather and travel is something we will always be grateful for! My birthday was the next day and Marie started it off right when she made me the most delicious eggs and sausage with excellent coffee. She is the perfect hostess. Please stay here if you can, it's #1 for a reason!!!
reviews.title: The best place we've ever stayed
Fantastic B&B
reviews.text: Spent two nights. Room was beautiful and clean. Had that charming New England feel. The location was perfect. The owners were gracious. The breakfast was excellent. We plan to go back. There is no reason to stay in a local hotel when you can stay here.

We have stayed at the Black Walnut Inn for the past four years while attending school events for our son. It is an absolutely wonderful bed & breakfast experience. The folks in charge are friendly and helpful. The Inn has very spacious and comfortable rooms. Breakfasts are delicious, with a wide choice of options. Marie makes some sort of tasty homemade coffee cake or muffins, along with a seasonal fruit to accompany the meal. I will always have fond memories of my many stays at the Black Walnut Inn and will definitely return if my travels bring me to the area. I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B in Amherst

reviews.text: We stayed at the Black Walnut Inn for three days for our daughter's commencement in Northampton along with our son and daughter's godparents. Our room (#2) and the godparents' room (#1) in the main house were both lovely and well appointed. Breakfast was excellent with eggs, pancakes, fresh baked goods, etc., at times of your choosing. The inn is outside of downtown Amherst in a quite part of the town and convenient to Rt. 9 without going through downtown or UMass. All the staff we friendly and helpful. We recommend the Black Walnut Inn most highly.
reviews.title: Spacious inn with wonderful rooms and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Black Walnut Inn with its friendly innkeeper and spacious rooms was a great choice for us. It was our base of operations for biking both the Norwottuck & Manhan Rail Trails. These flat trails w/no cars were a perfect way to explore. Big rivers, wildflowers galore, and mountain views combined to make it a wonderful vacation. A big bonus was, those days we didn't bike, we enjoyed all that Amherst, Northampton and Easthampton have to offer, Great restaurants, interesting shops, several college museums. A highlight was attending an opera workshop at UMass-incredible voices, full costumes and only $5.00. The best part of traveling is discoveries like this!
reviews.title: Biking Rail Trails in the Pioneer Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The BWI takes a pretty laid back approach. We arrived late Friday afternoon to find the instructions to locate our key and room taped to the door. Breakfast is served between 7 and 10 and it's pretty much anything you want (eggs, pancakes, etc.) and very well prepared. I really like this approach as opposed to the kind of rigidity you often find in B&Bs. The only downside was that the pilot light had gone off on the in-room heating and the room was quite cold. Since the owners were out at a family event, we had a couple of hours of shivering before they got home and were able to restart the stove. They were quite apologetic about it, and it didn't ruin the experience at all.
reviews.title: Very relaxing inn with a wonderful room

reviews.text: Best of all was our room. We stayed in the Kelleher room and I can't wait to go back. A huge room with 1 1/2 baths (wow!) One end has a sofa, comfy chair and coffee table for hanging out, and the other end is the sleeping area with a comfortable king size bed, bench and window seats. Very well appointed, and Lindt chocolates every day were a treat!
reviews.title: The Place to Stay in the Pioneer Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night at the Black Walnut Inn during a short vacation to the Amherst area and were very pleased that we did. The Poet's room was very quiet and had both a comfortable bed and a couch. The entire inn was extremely clean and beautifully furnished. The best part of the stay was the huge breakfast, including eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, French toast, homemade bread pudding and homemade muffins with homemade jam. Tricia was our wonderful, welcoming cook/waitress at breakfast, and Marie, the hard-working innkeeper. Another plus was the central air-conditioning in our room upstairs. We will definitely stay at the Black Walnut if we return to Amherst.
reviews.title: Quiet, friendly inn with top-notch breakfast

reviews.text: Over the July 4th weekend, we spent an evening at the Black Walnut Inn. A very pleasant experience. We were a party of three, and our room was spacious and comfortable, with two large queen beds. The Inn is in North Amherst, and very convenient to the colleges (Amherst, Mount Holyoke and Smith) we were visiting on our trip. Breakfast was marvelous, and the inn owner explained to us at length about her methods for making the preserves, the centerpiece of our morning meal. One of the jams was made of mulberries, which I had never tried. (The jams were for sale, so we loaded up with several jars.) We highly recommend this bed and breakfast: a nice, historic property with exceptionally friendly staff.
reviews.title: A pleasant overnight

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our vacation in Amherst, MA and are eager to spread the word about Black Walnut Inn. The hospitality we received was wonderful - matched by the amazing home-baked breads/muffins and wonderful jams of our host, Marie! Our room was lovely with the couch set apart from the bed which nicely accommodated our disparate bedtime schedules. The home was very clean and orderly, while at the same time, welcoming and available for use by the guests. Black Walnut Inn felt safe and inviting and was our home-away-from-home. I can't imagine anyone being less than pleased with Black Walnut Inn.
reviews.title: Hospitality Plus

reviews.text: Deb & Steve
reviews.title: Do not miss this!!

reviews.text: I was in Amherst to visit my son and family and to attend my grandson's high school graduation. This was absolutely a wonderful experience to stay at the Black Walnut Inn. My room (Carhart) was very large, beautifully decorated, very clean, very comfortable, and Marie was so gracious. You just did not want to leave! She showed me through some of the other rooms that were vacant at the time and all will provide a wonderful experience for your travels. All have private baths. Breakfast was from 7-10 in the family dining room--juice, coffee, tea, eggs, bacon, homemade bread and jams, pancakes, muffins--to your order. Every place you looked was another interesting item, piece of furniture, architectural feature. It was built in the 1700's and the place just drips with history. Do not leave without some of the homemade jam. I could just eat the whole jar! I have stayed in several B & B's and this is one of the very best. That part of the world has so many things to see, do, and visit and the people are friendly--I understand why my son just stayed there after getting his degree from UMASS.
reviews.title: We will miss the Black Walnut Inn!

description: The Black Walnut Inn, fronted by a stately Federal style brick home built in 1820, sits on acres of lawn shaded by tall black walnut trees. Located in historic North Amherst, we're just a few minutes from Amherst College, Deerfield Academy, UMass, and Hampshire College.
